Sentencas: The chemical strain effect in solids is the deviation from linear elasticity due to the association and dissociation of point defects.
Titulo: Practical applications of the chemical strain effect in ionic and mixed conductors

Sentencas: Although to date this effect has been observed and studied only in Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9, one may expect that it will be found in other ionic and mixed conductors containing a large concentration of point defects.
Titulo: Practical applications of the chemical strain effect in ionic and mixed conductors

Sentencas: In this work, some practical applications of materials exhibiting the chemical strain effect are discussed.
Titulo: Practical applications of the chemical strain effect in ionic and mixed conductors

Sentencas: Based on the example of Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9, mechanical structures built from these materials should exhibit exceptional mechanical stability and are therefore very attractive for use as components of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) or other devices subjected to large and frequent temperature variations.
Titulo: Practical applications of the chemical strain effect in ionic and mixed conductors

Sentencas: The ability of these materials to withstand large strain without accumulating large stress also makes them potentially useful as flexible elements in micro-electromechanical systems (MEMS).
Titulo: Practical applications of the chemical strain effect in ionic and mixed conductors
